lexUnit.name: shudder.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tremble or shake convulsively, especially as a result of fear or repugnance.

sentence.text: The cat shuddered as her bows bit into the swell .
She shuddered as convulsively as he did , and became lost in the same giant whirlpool of pleasure .
He shuddered slightly as he thought about Ramadan .
She shuddered when she looked in an open door and saw grey-faced children in beds with blue curtains round , propped up on pillows .
Her head was buried into her knees , arms clenched tightly around herself , and she shuddered violently when he touched her shoulder .
She shuddered when she thought what her fate might have been .
I remembered that they had never flown in a light aircraft before today ; I shuddered to think of what could happen if they panicked .
I shudder to think what kind of life I should have had with him .
She shuddered convulsively , and Guy 's arms tightened round her .
He shuddered involuntarily and walked on towards the printing works .
Mrs Vaughan shuddered slightly , and touched Leonora 's hand .
She was shuddering uncontrollably , either from cold or terror , or both .
Unhappily , it had only lasted a few short weeks , but all their friends still shuddered at the memory of their truly spectacular fights !
She shuddered at the pressure of his fingers .
I lay there on the couch and shuddered at the very thought .
At his words , Lina Salamanca 's body shuddered in the spasm of a monstrous sigh .
As we glanced at each other , we shuddered with apprehension .
He put out his hand and touched my wrist and I shuddered with delight .
The realisation made her shudder with guilt .
She shuddered with mortification .
I shuddered violently , thankful I was already on the floor .
For always , she promised her love , stretching up her arms to grip the curtains higher ; she shuddered and almost sobbed in her happiness .
